conclusion: Analyze the motion of the charged particle in the magnetic field and its interaction with the insulating plate ab.
The particle is injected with an initial velocity v0 at an angle of 45° to the line MN.
The vertical and horizontal components of the initial velocity are v0y = v0x = v0/√2.
The horizontal component of the velocity reverses while the vertical component remains unchanged after collision with the insulating plate ab.
After collision, the velocity components are vx = -v0/√2 and vy = v0/√2.
The particle undergoes circular motion due to the Lorentz force in the magnetic field.
The force is given by F = qvB = mv²/r, where r is the radius of the circular path.
The radius r of the circular path can be related to the distance 2d from point c to f using the geometry of the problem.
From the problem, the distance f is 2d horizontally from c.
The equation for the radius r in a magnetic field is r = mv/qB.
v is the magnitude of the velocity, which remains v0 because the speed does not change, only the direction does.
The particle makes a quarter circle before hitting the plate and then another quarter circle to reach point f, so the total horizontal distance covered is 2r.
Given that this distance is 2d, we have 2r = 2d, thus r = d.
Using the relation r = mv0/qB, we solve for B: B = mv0/qd.
The magnitude of the magnetic induction B of the magnetic field is B = mv0/qd.
